snippet: The space, a bright spot in classical and contemporary music in recent years, is to restructure and address “struggles with our current business model.”
abstract: SubCulture, Greenwich Village venue for performances by prominent orchestras, cancels upcoming events citing economic woes; founder Marc Kaplan said enterprise, designed for intimate, club-like experience, attracted New York Philharmonic and other well-known ensembles but was not making enough money to survive and must explore other options.
lead_paragraph: The space, a bright spot in classical and contemporary music in recent years, is to restructure and address “struggles with our current business model.”

headline.main: SubCulture in New York Cancels Much of Its Schedule
headline.print_headline: SubCulture, Fighting to Fill Seats, Cancels Bulk of Schedule
